H0.text: Electronegativity values are used to organize elements on the periodic table.

H1.text: Atomic mass is the basis on which elements are organized on the periodic table.

H2.text: Atomic number is the criterion by which elements are organized on the periodic table.

H3.text: The number of neutrons is what elements are organized on the periodic table according to.

A4.text: In the standard periodic table, the elements are listed in order of increasing atomic number.

A5.text: When atomic mass is shown, it is usually the weighted average of naturally occurring isotopes; but if no isotopes occur naturally in significant quantities, the mass of the most stable isotope usually appears, often in parentheses.
